tools.pki.gbay.crypto.texts

Class Base64

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.pki.gbay.crypto.texts.Base64
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EncodedTextInterface

    public class Base64
extends Object
implements EncodedTextInterface
    Generates a base64 encoded object
    Author:
    Araz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static byte[] base64Chars
      Table of the sixty-four characters that are used as the Base64 alphabet: [a-z0-9A-Z+/]
      protected static byte[] reverseBase64Chars
      Reverse lookup table for the Base64 alphabet.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Base64(byte[] bytes)
      Encode a byte array to base64
      Base64(File fileAddress)
      Load a file into base64 format
      Base64(InputStream plainInputStream)
      To encode a plain inputStream
      Base64(String encodedText)
      If you want to generate a Base64 object from an encoded text you need to use String

    • Field Detail

      • base64Chars

        protected static final byte[] base64Chars
        Table of the sixty-four characters that are used as the Base64 alphabet: [a-z0-9A-Z+/]

      • reverseBase64Chars

        protected static final byte[] reverseBase64Chars
        Reverse lookup table for the Base64 alphabet. reversebase64Chars[byte] gives n for the nth Base64 character or negative if a character is not a Base64 character.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Base64

        public Base64(String encodedText)
        If you want to generate a Base64 object from an encoded text you need to use String

        Otherwise use arrays of Byte Generate BASE64 object from a base64 encoded text

        Parameters:
        encodedText - base64 encoded String
        See Also:
        Base64(byte[])

      • Base64

        public Base64(byte[] bytes)
        Encode a byte array to base64

        Note: If your text is already a base64 encoded text use the constructor with STRING String

        Parameters:
        bytes - plain byte array
